title: 110_s2455
content:
The "Community Foreclosure Assistance Act of 2007" may be cited as the short title. Additional emergency CDBG funding is addressed in the Act. $1,000,000,000 is authorized to assist States, cities, and counties with community development block grants for foreclosure impact and rental assistance. The text chunk discusses the allocation of funds for foreclosure-based rental assistance for individual renters, excluding homeowners from receiving financial assistance for foreclosure prevention purposes. The curr_chunk defines a "certified housing counseling service" as an agency approved by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. SEC. 3. INCREASED PUBLIC SERVICES REQUIREMENT CAP.

The Act increases the public services requirement cap from 15% to 25% for all funds appropriated under this Act.

SEC. 4. LOW AND MODERATE INCOME REQUIREMENT.

At least 50% of the funds under this Act must primarily benefit low- and moderate-income individuals. (a) Comprehensive Plan.--Funds under this Act cannot be used until a comprehensive plan is submitted and approved by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
(b) Report on Use of Funds.--Recipients must submit quarterly reports detailing the use of funds to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. Development describing and accounting for the use of all funds expended during the applicable period. SEC. 6. WAIVERS. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development can waive provisions of statutes or regulations to facilitate the use of funds, except for certain requirements like fair housing and labor standards, upon request by a State, metropolitan city, or urban county. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development can waive certain requirements of the statute, such as the low and moderate income requirement and public services cap, upon request by a State, metropolitan city, or urban county if a compelling need is demonstrated. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development can waive certain requirements of the statute if a compelling need is demonstrated. Waivers must be published in the Federal Register and reviewed every two years for reauthorization. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development can waive requirements of the statute if a compelling need is shown. Waivers must be published in the Federal Register and committees in Congress must be notified of any waivers granted or denied. SEC. 7. Noncompliance with community development requirements under this Act will be subject to the provisions of section 111 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. SEC. 8. A GAO audit will be conducted. The Comptroller General of the United States will conduct an audit of funds appropriated under this Act and submit a report to the Senate and House committees. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will provide quarterly reports to the Senate and House Committees on the use of funds, including the number of households receiving counseling and rental assistance, outcomes of assistance activities, certified housing counseling services, and any other relevant information. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will provide quarterly reports to Congress on the use of funds, including relevant information and steps taken to prevent fraud and abuse.
